description: Celebrating among the melee of Hollywood's finest at Fox's Golden Globes afterparty, the Pokerface singer couldn't take her mind off her unexpected Best Actress win.
title: Lady Gaga kisses her Golden Globe award as she celebrates win at FOX afterparty
title_page: Lady Gaga kisses her Golden Globe award as she celebrates win at FOX afterparty | Daily Mail Online
text:
She's widely regarded as a queen of pop, but Lady Gaga triumphed in the acting world on Sunday night.
Celebrating among the melee of Hollywood's finest at FOX's Golden Globes afterparty, the Pokerface singer couldn't take her mind off her unexpected Best Actress win.
The 29-year-old, who took the gong for her part in American Horror Story: Hotel, certainly looked the part as she kissed the golden trophy, oozing vintage red carpet glamour.
Scroll down for video
Not done yet: Golden Globe award winner Lady Gaga headed to the Fox afterparty to mark the win on Sunday night
Having scooped the win, Gaga was not about to head home with her fiance Taylor Kinney and celebrate the win in silence.
She was bold about the accolade and took to the red carpet once again for a glamorous arrival at one of the star-studded post-parties.
Her statue was in one hand as she jutted out a hip and posed like a true pro before the baiting cameras.
Old Hollywood: The blonde cut a Marilyn Monroe-inspired figure with her hair in voluminous curls and her dress accentuating her curves
Trophy: She wasn't ready to head home on such a triumphant evening
Gaga's carefully manicured nails helped to grip the globe on top as she puckered up and gave it a kiss.
She had played The Countess in the FX drama, turning her hand to acting after seven years at the top of the pop game.
The star was therefore recognised in the Best Performance by an Actress in a Mini-Series or Motion Picture Made for Television category.
On the glamour front, the star was oozing old Hollywood glamour, fitting in perfectly with the A-list red carpet crowd.
Singer-turned-actress: Gaga was thrilled to have been recognised for her acting talents
Winner, winner: She couldn't hide her delight at such an unexpected accolade
Erased her ink! Even more impressive, Lady Gaga covered up all of the tattoos on the left side of her body with body make-up
She exaggerated her 5ft1in hourglass figure with a corseted and padded black Atelier Versace gown selected by her stylist of seven years, Brandon Maxwell.
Her hair was Marilyn Monroe-esque in giant platinum curls at the nape of her neck and swept over high from a far side parting.
Gaga's make-up, meanwhile, was understated and featured bold yet natural-looking brows, subtle pink lipstick and elegant smokey eye make-up to define her features.
Vintage: Her appearance was full of glamour, even as she partied after the party
A visibly stunned Gaga stumbled through the acceptance speech for her first-ever Golden Globe on the night.
'I feel like Cher in that John Patrick Shanley movie Moonstruck,' the Cheek to Cheek songstress said onstage the Beverly Hilton.
'This is one of the greatest moments of my life...I am really and truly speechless.'
Gaga - born Stefani Germanotta - confessed she 'wanted to be an actress before a singer, but music worked out first.'
'This is one of the greatest moments of my life!' A visibly stunned Gaga stumbled through the acceptance speech for her first-ever Golden Globe win
Her reaction: The 29-year-old pop diva seemed to be genuinely taken aback by her win
Checking in? The Artpop singer won for her role as the blood-lusting hotelier The Countess in FX's American Horror Story: Hotel
Even so, Mother Monster still beat established film and TV stars Sarah Hay, Felicity Huffman, Queen Latifah and Kirsten Dunst.
It's an impressive feat for the Applause Singer, whose only prior roles were Bertha in Sin City: A Dame to Kill For last year and La Camaleón in Machete Kills in 2013.
And while Gaga managed to thank her family, cast and 'wonderful human being' AHS creator Ryan Murphy - she forgot fiancé Taylor Kinney.
The omittance was particularly noteworthy since the 34-year-old actor singled her out when he won a People's Choice Award for Favourite Dramatic TV Actor last Wednesday.

After the six-time Grammy winner's Cher shout-out, 69-year-old pop icon tweeted: 'SO PROUD GAGA #BIRDSOFAFEATHER' to her 2.9M followers.
